In this dark chamber, sobs and sighs availed nothing—I fainted—and by the cursed mead of man's superior strength I lost—what can never be recovered—The villain (for one went out and shut the fatal key upon the door)
soon as his brutal purpose was accomplish∣ed, crept out the door, and left his handker∣chief, telling me that he'd soon return and pay me for the trouble he had been the cause of—Pay me—Good heavens—

SP.SPEAKER: HARTLY.
SP.P: 'Twill then be best to wait his coming— hark— (A cry without)

SP.SPEAKER: CLARISA.
SP.P: My father—sure 'tis my father's voice.

SP.SPEAKER: CLARISA.
SP.P: O my father.

SP.SPEAKER: HARTLY.
SP.P: No time—too precious, sir, to be lost.— Your daughter—sir, guess the whole—my tongue would faulter at so base a tale—

SP.SPEAKER: DOCTOR.
SP.P: And mine faulters now so I can't speak a single word.

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: Where is the wretch?

SP.SPEAKER: HARTLY.
SP.P:
He'll soon return—Doctor, go find an of∣ficer, at once, (Exit Doctor.) Close the door,
lest he mistrust—for he will soon be here— stand ready to seize him and others if there are—let us blow out the light we'll then be sure to catch him.

DIV3.STAGE: (Haven and Samuel open the door softly and enter—Colonel and Hartly seize them, and with Punctum hold them fast.)

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: Who are you? Tell me who you are.

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN.
SP.P: Let me alone—I'll not tell you who I am.

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: Tell me who you are.

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN.
SP.P: Let me alone, I'll not tell you who I am.

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: Ay struggle—you're grappled by an arm that will hold you fast till you're delivered to the sheriff's hands.

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN.
SP.P: Sam, where are you?

SP.SPEAKER: SAMUEL.
SP.P: In just such a box as yourself, only it takes two to hold me.

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN.
SP.P: Good Lord—A sheriff's coming.

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: Are you a sheriff?

SP.SPEAKER: SHERIFF.
SP.P: Ay, a deputy sheriff, sir, I am.

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: Here, take these fellows under your care— Let them not go, upon your peril—I'll have a mittimus in half an hour. (Exit Colonel.)

SP.SPEAKER: DOCTOR.
SP.P: Now you're safe, you dogs—Miss Clara, do you know me? I am Doctor Hoaks—a physician and surgeon—and I believe you're the same Lady that is in love with me—'Tis I that got this sheriff—tis I that found out where you was—all I.

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN.
SP.P: Oh don't carry us to goal—oh don't.

SP.SPEAKER: SHERIFF.
SP.P: If you have done no ill, you will be rec∣ompensed for all your troubles—If crimes are alledged against you, and are proved, then you need fear a goal, and more a court of justice.

SP.SPEAKER: CLARISA.
SP.P: But Oh—what court of justice can do jus∣tice to me?

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN.
SP.P: Oh madam, can you forgive me—forgive me—I'll grant this hand—the hand of wealth and reputation.

SP.SPEAKER: CLARISA.
SP.P: I disdain the hand, the head, the heart— If such a wretch as you have wealth and rep∣utation, no honest woman would except of them. (Enter Colonel.)

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: Wretch—soon shall the strong goal con∣tain that cursed heart—and if there be force in the laws of this commonwealth—ere long, I'll see your carcase swinging in the air—tied to an honest rope—Are there not prostitutes enough in this town to satisfy your base un∣bridled passions?

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN.
SP.P: I've offered to marry her.

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: I'd rather marry her to that simple Doctor, who well deserves my thanks for his assistance in detecting you.

SP.SPEAKER: DOCTOR.
SP.P: You call me simple, sir—I compound all my medicines.

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P: Here are two crowns for your trouble, Doctor, I believe we shall have no more need of your assistance.

SP.SPEAKER: DOCTOR.
SP.P: Ah well—this will do as well as a wife, till it's spent—but do get that man hanged.

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN,
SP.P: Ah but forgive me—I'll wear out years in prayers and penitence—I'll be your bound slave during life.

SP.SPEAKER: COLONEL.
SP.P:
Not one year can you have for prayers and penitence—use well the few remaining days of life—there's no repentance in the grave—you plead for mercy—shall one eyed mercy browbeat the honest claims of justice, and save that devil for whom the gallows waits—You robbed me of my joys—my daughter of her virgin purity—and you shall die—your associate—and your land∣lord, shall feel the vengeance of the law. This handkerchief betrays your name at full—I know your character—The goaler'll soon be here to drag you to the house appoint∣ed
for the authors of crimes like yours.

SP.SPEAKER: COL. FARSTER.
SP.P: Here take this villain; who has so long defrauded the goal of its just dues,

SP.SPEAKER: HAVEN.
SP.L: O GOD of mercy! hear my prayer!
And when I stand before the bar of Heaven,
Oh may my vile offences be forgiven.
